results.title: Scott Tinley's triathlon training: with Juli Brening
results.brief_description: Veteran Scott Tinley and top triathlete Juli Brening share their training methods and performance tips drawn from years of experience in this most demanding and complex sport. Together they cover swimming, running, cycling, nutrition, weight training and race day strategy.

results.title: Scott of the Antarctic
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Sir Michael Balcon and Charles Frend
results.brief_description: Saga of the ill fated 1912 expedition led by Captain Robert Scott which aimed to be the first to reach the South Pole. Features John Mills, James Robertson Justice and Kenneth Moore.

results.title: Scott Joplin: king of ragtime composers
results.creator_credit: Anastos and Associates and Amelia Anderson
results.brief_description: Presents the life and music of ragtime musician, Scott Joplin, narrated by Eartha Kitt. Includes early film footage of the Mississippi River life and the 1904 St. Louis World’s Fair.

results.title: Scots of tomorrow
results.brief_description: The Junior Secondary Schools in Scotland. Illustrates the wide variety of the school curriculum and its careful integration in the everyday life of the pupils. Stress is laid on the acquisition of practical skills and experience simultaneously with the understanding of principles; all with the child’s needs in adult life clearly in view.

results.title: Scotland: the grand tour
results.creator_credit: Scotia International Television, Lawrence Riva and Alex Riva
results.brief_description: Join John Shedden as he narrates a journey around the sights of Scotland. Included on the stop over are: homes of literary figures Robert Burns and Sir Walter Scott, the River Tweed and the popular activities that she offers, St Andrews Golf Course, University of Saint Andrews, the oldest Norman church in Scotland, Earls Hall, Glamis and Blair Castles, battle sights, the Highland Games, Lang Brothers distillery, pubs, Loch Ness, The Trossachs, Pitlochry, Edinburgh, Loch Lomond, Glencoe, Culloden and many more enticements to potential visitors of this lovely country.

results.title: Scotland: land of legends
results.creator_credit: International Video Network, Susan Templin, Peter May and Chip Duncan
results.brief_description: Narrated by John McIlwraith this video provides the viewer with an armchair guide of Scotland, land of legends. Explore the history of golf, visit Glasgow, the Barras, the rugged landscape of the Hebrides, Aberdeen, the River Tweed, Glenfiddich Distillery, Loch Ness, Urquhart Castle, and Dryburgh Abbey, resting place of Sir Walter Scott.

results.title: Scotland: background of literature
results.brief_description: The battlefields of the Border Country, the Lowlands and the rugged Highlands of Scotland have provided the inspiration for the works of Robert Burns, Walter Scott, Stevenson, Defoe and others. Picturing scenes from these various parts of Scotland, the film provides a background for the study and appreciation of the stories and poems of Scottish writers.

results.title: Scotland Yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Aspects of the work of Scotland Yard detectives are illustrated in an accident following a warehouse robbery and how the various Yard departments and other police departments work in cooperation. Traces the case through from the stealing of a car carrying a load of tea to the conviction of the criminals involved in it. Briefly shows the various methods of identification, namely, by fingerprint, by photograph, and on parade in front of a witness.
